environment are provided. The robot can include a body having a longitudinal axis and having a control unit and a power source. The robot can include a first leg pair including a first leg and a second leg. Each leg of the first leg pair can be pivotally attached to the body and constrained to pivot in a first leg pair plane that is substantially perpendicular to the longitudinal axis of the body.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="540" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">No Copyright.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="653" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Cybernetics, Artificial Intelligence and Robotics</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="700" ind1="1" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Behar, Alberto E.,</subfield><subfield code="e">author.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="700" ind1="1" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Poole, Michael D.,</subfield><subfield code="e">author.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="700" ind1="1" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Wall, Jonathan N.,</subfield><subfield code="e">author.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="793" ind1="0" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">NASA Technical Reports Server (NTRS) Collection.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="856" ind1="4" ind2="1"><subfield code="7">0</subfield><subfield code="u">http://hdl.handle.net/2060/20110015438</subfield><subfield code="z">Connect to this object online.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="949" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Electronic resource</subfield><subfield code="w">ASIS</subfield><subfield code="c">1</subfield><subfield code="i">16202490-1001</subfield><subfield code="l">ONLINE</subfield><subfield code="m">ONLINE</subfield><subfield code="r">Y</subfield><subfield code="s">Y</subfield><subfield code="t">ONLINE</subfield><subfield code="u">9/23/2015</subfield><subfield code="o">.STAFF. notes_summary_ssim: A robot and robot system that are capable of functioning in a zero-gravity environment are provided. The robot can include a body having a longitudinal axis and having a control unit and a power source. The robot can include a first leg pair including a first leg and a second leg. Each leg of the first leg pair can be pivotally attached to the body and constrained to pivot in a first leg pair plane that is substantially perpendicular to the longitudinal axis of the body.
